article:
Jawan (film)

Jawan is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Atlee and produced by Gauri Khan and Red Chillies Entertainment. The film stars Shah Rukh Khan, Nayanthara, and Vijay Sethupathi in lead roles. Jawan is set to be released in 2023 and has generated significant buzz among fans and critics alike.

# Plot

The plot of Jawan revolves around a mysterious yet intriguing character, played by Shah Rukh Khan, who is on a mission to uncover the truth behind a series of unexplained events. As the story unfolds, the protagonist finds himself entangled in a complex web of conspiracy, deceit, and betrayal. With the help of a determined journalist, played by Nayanthara, he sets out to expose the culprits and bring justice to the victims.

Vijay Sethupathi plays a pivotal role in the film, as a ruthless and cunning adversary who will stop at nothing to achieve his goals. The movie promises to be an action-packed thrill ride, with high-octane sequences, heart-pumping stunts, and unexpected twists and turns.

# Cast

* Shah Rukh Khan as the protagonist
* Nayanthara as a determined journalist
* Vijay Sethupathi as the main antagonist
* Priyamani as a supporting character
* Yogi Babu as a comedic relief
* Sanya Malhotra as a supporting character
* Sunil Grover as a supporting character

# Production

## Development

The concept of Jawan was born out of a desire to create a cinematic experience that would push the boundaries of storytelling and action. Atlee, the director, wanted to craft a film that would be both entertaining and thought-provoking. The script was developed over several months, with input from the cast and crew.

## Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first choice for the lead role, given his proven track record of delivering blockbuster hits. Nayanthara and Vijay Sethupathi were brought on board soon after, with the rest of the cast being finalized over the next few months.

## Filming

Principal photography began in 2022 and wrapped up in early 2023. The film was shot on location in various parts of India, with a significant portion being filmed in Chennai and Hyderabad. The action sequences were choreographed by a team of international stunt experts, ensuring that the film would live up to its promise of delivering high-octane thrills.

## Post-production

Post-production work began shortly after filming wrapped up. The editing team worked tirelessly to ensure that the film would be both engaging and coherent. The visual effects team added the finishing touches, enhancing the action sequences and adding depth to the narrative.

# Themes and influences

Jawan explores a range of themes, including corruption, power, and the fight for justice. The film is influenced by a range of cinematic styles, from Bollywood to Hollywood. Atlee has cited films like The Dark Knight and The Bourne Series as inspirations for the movie's action sequences and plot twists.

# Music

The music for Jawan is being composed by Anirudh Ravichander, with lyrics by Kumaar and Javed Akhtar. The soundtrack promises to be a fusion of traditional Indian music with modern electronic elements. The film's score is being composed by G. V. Prakash Kumar.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for Jawan began several months ago, with the release of a series of teasers and trailers. The film's social media handles have been actively promoting the movie, sharing behind-the-scenes glimpses and sneak peeks. Shah Rukh Khan has been actively involved in the promotional activities, attending press conferences and interacting with fans.

# Release

## Theatrical

Jawan is set to be released in theaters worldwide on June 2, 2023. The film will be released in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu.

## Distribution

The film will be distributed by Red Chillies Entertainment, with a wide release planned across India and internationally.

## Home media

The film will be available on streaming platforms shortly after its theatrical release.

# Reception

## Box office

Jawan is expected to perform well at the box office, given its star-studded cast and high-octane action sequences. The film's marketing campaign has generated significant buzz among fans, with many predicting a blockbuster opening weekend.

## Critical response

Early reviews for the film have been positive, with critics praising the film's action sequences and performances. However, some have noted that the plot may be predictable, with a few twists and turns feeling overly familiar.

# Accolades

Jawan has already received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Actor for Shah Rukh Khan at the upcoming Filmfare Awards.

# Future

A sequel to Jawan is already in the works, with Atlee and Shah Rukh Khan set to return. The film's success will likely pave the way for a franchise, with several more installments planned.

# Notes

Jawan marks a significant milestone in Shah Rukh Khan's career, as it is his first film with Atlee and Red Chillies Entertainment. The film's success will likely have a significant impact on the Indian film industry, paving the way for more action-packed thrillers.

# References

article:
Liga 1 (Indonesia)
=====================

Liga 1 is the top professional association football league in Indonesia. It was founded in 2008 and is operated by the Football Association of Indonesia (PSSI). The league is contested by 18 clubs and operates on a system of promotion and relegation with Liga 2, the second tier of Indonesian football.

History
--------

### Origins

The concept of a professional football league in Indonesia dates back to the 1990s. However, the league was plagued by problems such as poor management, low attendance, and lack of sponsorship. In 2008, the PSSI decided to reform the league and create a new professional competition.

### Foundation

Liga 1 was officially founded on April 15, 2008, with the aim of improving the standard of football in Indonesia. The league was initially composed of 18 teams, selected from the top two divisions of Indonesian football.

### Dualism

In 2011, the PSSI and the Indonesian Professional Sports Agency (BOPI) disagreed over the management of the league. This led to the creation of a rival league, the Indonesian Premier League (IPL), which was not recognized by FIFA. The dualism between the two leagues caused confusion and instability in Indonesian football.

### Government intervention and FIFA suspension

In 2015, the Indonesian government intervened in the dispute between the PSSI and BOPI, leading to the suspension of the IPL. However, the dispute continued, and in 2015, FIFA suspended the PSSI due to government interference in the sport. The suspension was lifted in 2016, and the PSSI was allowed to continue managing the league.

### Name change

In 2017, the league was rebranded as Liga 1, replacing the previous name, Indonesia Super League (ISL).

Competition format
-------------------

### Competition

Liga 1 is contested by 18 teams, with each team playing the others twice, once at home and once away. The team with the most points at the end of the season is crowned the champion.

### Promotion and relegation

The bottom three teams in Liga 1 are relegated to Liga 2, while the top three teams in Liga 2 are promoted to Liga 1.

### Video assistant referee

In 2019, Liga 1 became the first league in Southeast Asia to introduce the video assistant referee (VAR) system.

Clubs
------

### Champions

A total of 12 teams have won the Liga 1 title since its inception in 2008. The most successful team is Persipura Jayapura, with four titles.

Awards

article:
2023 Monterey Park shooting

The 2023 Monterey Park shooting was a mass shooting that occurred on January 21, 2023, in Monterey Park, California, United States. It was one of the deadliest mass shootings in the United States in recent years, resulting in the deaths of 11 people and injuring nine others.

#Background

Monterey Park is a city located in Los Angeles County, California, with a population of approximately 61,000 people. The city is known for its cultural diversity, with a significant Asian American population. The shooting occurred during the Lunar New Year celebrations, which is a significant holiday in many Asian cultures.

The area where the shooting took place is a predominantly Asian American neighborhood, with many businesses and restaurants catering to the local community. The Star Ballroom Dance Studio, where the shooting occurred, is a popular gathering place for seniors and others who enjoy dancing.

#Events

##Monterey Park shooting

On January 21, 2023, at around 10:20 p.m., a gunman entered the Star Ballroom Dance Studio, located at 122 West Garvey Avenue in Monterey Park. The studio was hosting a Lunar New Year's Eve celebration, and the event was attended by many people, including seniors and families with young children.

The gunman, who was later identified as Huu Can Tran, opened fire on the crowd, shooting indiscriminately. Witnesses described the scene as chaotic, with people screaming and running for cover. The shooting lasted for approximately 10-15 minutes, during which time the gunman fired multiple rounds.

##Alhambra incident

After the shooting at the Star Ballroom Dance Studio, the gunman fled the scene and drove to the nearby city of Alhambra, where he attempted to enter the Lai Lai Ballroom & Studio. However, he was confronted by a group of people who were able to disarm him and prevent him from entering the building.

##Gunman's suicide

After the incident in Alhambra, the gunman fled the scene and drove to a parking lot in Torrance, California, where he took his own life. He was found dead in his van, which was registered in his name.

#Victims

The shooting resulted in the deaths of 11 people, ranging in age from 50 to 80. The victims were identified as:

* Ming Ma, 72
* Yu Kao, 72
* Chia Ling Yau, 76
* Wen Yu, 62
* Lilan Li, 63
* Xiujuan Yu, 57
* Hongying Jian, 62
* Muoi Ung, 67
* Diana Tom, 70
* Valentino Marcos Alvero, 68
* My Nhan, 65

Nine others were injured in the shooting, including a 57-year-old man who was listed in critical condition.

#Perpetrator

The gunman was identified as Huu Can Tran, a 72-year-old man from Hemet, California. Tran was a licensed real estate agent and had no prior criminal record. He was known to frequent the Star Ballroom Dance Studio, where he would often dance and socialize with others.

According to reports, Tran had a history of mental health issues and had been known to make threatening statements to others in the past. However, it is unclear what motivated him to carry out the shooting.

#Reactions

The shooting was widely condemned by officials and community leaders, who expressed shock and sadness at the loss of life. The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department and the FBI launched an investigation into the shooting, which is ongoing.

The incident also raised concerns about gun violence and the need for greater mental health support. Many people in the community expressed a sense of trauma and grief, and there were calls for greater resources to support those affected.

* Gun violence in the United States
* Mental health in the United States

article:
Oppenheimer (film)

Oppenheimer is an upcoming biographical drama film written and directed by Christopher Nolan, based on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the director of the Manhattan Project. The film is a co-production between Universal Pictures, Atlas Entertainment, and Syncopy, and is scheduled for release in July 2023.

**Plot**

The film tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, a brilliant and complex scientist who played a crucial role in the development of the atomic bomb during World War II. The story follows Oppenheimer's journey from his early days as a young scientist to his appointment as the director of the Manhattan Project, and explores the moral implications of his work. The film also delves into Oppenheimer's personal life, including his relationships with his wife, Kitty, and his mistress, Jean Tatlock.

**Cast**

* Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer
* Emily Blunt as Kitty Oppenheimer
* Matt Damon as Leslie Groves
* Robert Downey Jr. as Lewis Strauss
* Florence Pugh as Jean Tatlock
* Rami Malek as Lyndon B. Johnson
* Benny Safdie as Edward Teller
* Josh Hartnett as Ernest Lawrence
* Dane DeHaan as Kenneth Nichols
* Alden Ehrenreich as unknown

**Production**

### Development

Christopher Nolan first became interested in telling the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer in the early 2000s, but it wasn't until 2020 that he began working on the project in earnest. Nolan spent several years researching Oppenheimer's life and the history of the Manhattan Project, and eventually wrote a script that would become the basis for the film.

### Writing

Nolan's script for Oppenheimer is based on several books about the scientist's life, including American Prometheus: The Triumph and Tragedy of J. Robert Oppenheimer by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin. The script also draws on Oppenheimer's own writings and interviews, as well as those of his colleagues and contemporaries.

### Casting

Cillian Murphy was Nolan's first choice to play Oppenheimer, and he was officially cast in the role in October 2020. Emily Blunt was cast as Kitty Oppenheimer in January 2021, followed by Matt Damon as Leslie Groves and Robert Downey Jr. as Lewis Strauss.

### Filming

Principal photography on Oppenheimer began in February 2021 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in New Mexico, California, and the United Kingdom, using a combination of digital and IMAX cameras.

### Post-production

Post-production on Oppenheimer began in the summer of 2021 and is ongoing. The film's editor is Jennifer Lame, who has worked with Nolan on several previous projects. The visual effects are being handled by DNEG, which has also worked with Nolan on several films.

**Music**

The score for Oppenheimer is being composed by Ludwig Göransson, who has worked with Nolan on several previous projects. The score will be performed by a large orchestra and will feature a combination of traditional and electronic elements.

**Marketing**

Universal Pictures began releasing promotional materials for Oppenheimer in the summer of 2022, including a teaser trailer and several posters. The film's marketing campaign is expected to ramp up in the coming months, with a full trailer and several TV spots scheduled for release.

**Release**

### Theatrical

Oppenheimer is scheduled for release in July 2023. The film will be released in IMAX and other premium formats, and will be shown in theaters around the world.

#### Classifications and censorship

Oppenheimer has been rated R by the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) for "some violence and language." The film has also been rated 15 by the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC) for "strong language and violence."

### Home media

Oppenheimer will be released on home media in the fall of 2023. The film will be available on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms, and will include several bonus features, including a behind-the-scenes documentary and several deleted scenes.

**Reception**

### Box office

#### United States and Canada

Oppenheimer is expected to perform well at the box office in the United States and Canada. The film's opening weekend is projected to be around $40-50 million, with a total domestic gross of around $150-200 million.

#### Japan

Oppenheimer is also expected to perform well in Japan, where Christopher Nolan's films have traditionally been popular. The film's opening weekend is projected to be around $10-15 million, with a total Japanese gross of around $50-75 million.

#### Other territories

Oppenheimer is expected to perform well in other territories around the world, including the United Kingdom, Australia, and China. The film's global gross is projected to be around $500-700 million.

### Critical response

Oppenheimer has received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's performances, direction, and historical accuracy. The film has been praised for its nuanced portrayal of Oppenheimer and the moral implications of his work.

### Influence on legislation

Oppenheimer has also been credited with influencing legislation related to nuclear energy and disarmament. The film's portrayal of the devastating effects of nuclear war has been praised for raising awareness about the importance of disarmament and non-proliferation.

**Accuracy and omissions**

Oppenheimer has been praised for its historical accuracy, but some have criticized the film for omitting certain details about Oppenheimer's life and the history of the Manhattan Project. The film's portrayal of Oppenheimer's relationships with his colleagues and contemporaries has also been subject to some criticism.

**Accolades**

Oppenheimer has received several awards and nominations, including several Academy Award nominations. The film's performances, direction, and historical accuracy have been widely praised.

**See also**

* J. Robert Oppenheimer
* Manhattan Project
* Atomic bomb
* Nuclear energy
* Disarmament

**Notes**

This article is a general overview of the film Oppenheimer. For more information, please see the film's official website and promotional materials.

article:
2023 NCAA Division I baseball tournament

The 2023 NCAA Division I baseball tournament was the 75th edition of the NCAA Division I baseball tournament, which determined the NCAA Division I college baseball champion for the 2023 season. The tournament was held from May 31 to June 26, 2023, and featured 64 college baseball teams from across the United States.

#Tournament procedure

The tournament was a double-elimination tournament, with teams competing in a best-of-three series in the Super Regionals and a best-of-three series in the College World Series (CWS) finals. The tournament was divided into several rounds, including the Regionals, Super Regionals, and the CWS. The Regionals were held at 16 sites across the country, with each site featuring four teams competing in a double-elimination format. The winners of each Regional advanced to the Super Regionals, where they competed in a best-of-three series against another Regional winner. The winners of the Super Regionals advanced to the CWS in Omaha, Nebraska.

#National seeds

The NCAA Division I Baseball Committee selected 16 teams to receive national seeds, which were used to determine the top eight teams in the tournament. The top eight national seeds were:

1. Wake Forest
2. Stanford
3. Arkansas
4. LSU
5. Virginia
6. Oregon State
7. Vanderbilt
8. Miami (FL)

#Schedule and venues

The Regionals were held from May 31 to June 5, with the Super Regionals held from June 9 to June 12. The CWS was held from June 16 to June 26 at TD Ameritrade Park Omaha in Omaha, Nebraska.

#Bids

##Automatic bids

Thirty-one teams received automatic bids to the tournament by winning their conference tournament.

##By conference

* America East: Binghamton
* American Athletic Conference: Tulane
* Atlantic 10 Conference: Richmond
* Atlantic Coast Conference: Wake Forest
* ASUN Conference: Liberty
* Big 12 Conference: Oklahoma State
* Big East Conference: Connecticut
* Big South Conference: Campbell
* Big Ten Conference: Indiana
* Colonial Athletic Association: Northeastern

article:
Federal Prosecution of Donald Trump (Classified Documents Case)

The federal prosecution of Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, in the classified documents case, is an ongoing legal proceeding that began in 2023. The case involves allegations that Trump improperly removed and retained classified documents at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida, following his departure from office in January 2021.

# Background

In January 2021, following his departure from office, Trump took with him a large number of boxes and documents, including classified materials, to his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida. The National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) subsequently requested that Trump return all presidential records, including classified documents, to their custody. After a series of negotiations, Trump returned a number of boxes to NARA in January 2022. However, in May 2022, NARA informed the Department of Justice (DOJ) that the boxes returned by Trump contained classified materials, leading to an investigation by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

# Indictments and Arraignments

## Original Indictment

On June 8, 2023, a federal grand jury in the Southern District of Florida returned an indictment against Trump, charging him with 32 counts of willful retention of national defense information, concealment of documents, and corruptly concealing documents. The indictment alleged that Trump had improperly removed and retained classified documents, including top-secret and sensitive compartmented information, at his Mar-a-Lago estate.

## Superseding Indictment

On July 27, 2023, a superseding indictment was returned, adding new charges against Trump and two co-defendants, Waltine "Walt" Nauta and Carlos De Oliveira. The superseding indictment alleged that Nauta and De Oliveira had assisted Trump in concealing documents and obstructing the investigation.

## Assignment of District Judge

The case was assigned to Judge Aileen Cannon of the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida.

## Arraignments

### Trump

Trump was arraigned on June 13, 2023, and pleaded not guilty to all charges.

### Nauta

Nauta was arraigned on July 27, 2023, and pleaded not guilty to all charges.

### De Oliveira

De Oliveira was arraigned on July 27, 2023, and pleaded not guilty to all charges.

# Pretrial Proceedings

## 2023

In the months following the indictment, the parties engaged in pretrial proceedings, including discovery and motion practice. Trump's lawyers filed a series of motions seeking to dismiss the charges and limit the scope of the prosecution.

## 2024

In January 2024, Trump's lawyers filed a motion seeking to indefinitely delay the trial, citing the complexity of the case and the need for additional time to prepare.

### Trump's Request to Indefinitely Delay Trial

Trump's request to delay the trial was met with opposition from the prosecution, which argued that the case was ready for trial and that further delays would prejudice the government's ability to present its case.

# Dismissal and Appeal

On February 10, 2024, Judge Cannon granted Trump's motion to dismiss the charges, ruling that the prosecution had failed to establish a prima facie case. The government appealed the dismissal to the United States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit.

# Response

## To Indictment

### Trump

Trump responded to the indictment by denying any wrongdoing and claiming that the charges were politically motivated.

### Other Republicans

Other Republican politicians and commentators also responded to the indictment, with many echoing Trump's claims of political motivations.

### Democrats

Democratic politicians and commentators responded to the indictment by emphasizing the seriousness of the charges and the need for accountability.

## To Dismissal

The dismissal of the charges was met with widespread criticism from Democratic politicians and commentators, who argued that the decision was unjust and undermined the rule of law.

article:
Jimmy Buffett
================

James William Buffett is a renowned American singer, songwriter, musician, author, and entrepreneur. Born on December 25, 1946, in Pascagoula, Mississippi, Buffett has become a cultural icon, best known for his island-inspired music and laid-back lifestyle. With a career spanning over five decades, Buffett has released numerous chart-topping albums, written several bestselling novels, and built a business empire that includes restaurants, resorts, and other ventures.

Early Life
----------

Jimmy Buffett was born to James Delaney Buffett Jr. and Mary Loriane Peets Buffett. His father was a naval historian and a sailor, and the family moved frequently during Buffett's childhood, eventually settling in Mobile, Alabama. Buffett's love for music began at an early age, influenced by the likes of Hank Williams and Bing Crosby. He started playing the guitar in high school and formed his first band, The Upstairs, while attending the University of Southern Mississippi.

Music Career
------------

Jimmy Buffett's music career began in the late 1960s, playing gigs in local bars and clubs in New Orleans and Mobile. In 1970, he moved to Nashville, Tennessee, to pursue a career in country music, where he recorded his first album, "Down to Earth," for the Barnaby Records label. However, it was his 1973 album, "A White Sport Coat and a Pink Crustacean," that brought him his first taste of success, with the single "Come Monday" reaching the top 30 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

### Musical Style

Buffett's music style is a unique blend of folk, rock, country, and island music, often referred to as "gulf and western" or "island rock." His songs often tell stories of love, heartache, and adventure, set against the backdrop of the Gulf Coast and the Caribbean. Buffett's distinctive vocal style, characterized by his smooth, raspy baritone, has become instantly recognizable.

### Musical Legacy

Jimmy Buffett's impact on popular music is undeniable. He has released over 30 studio albums, numerous live albums, and compilations, selling over 20 million records worldwide. He has had numerous chart-topping singles, including "Margaritaville," "Fins," and "Cheeseburger in Paradise." Buffett's music has influenced a wide range of artists, from Kenny Chesney to Zac Brown, and his iconic songs have become staples of American popular culture.

### "Parrot Head" Fans

Buffett's devoted fan base, known as "Parrot Heads," are a testament to his enduring popularity. The Parrot Heads are a community of fans who share a love for Buffett's music, lifestyle, and philanthropic efforts. They have been known to create elaborate tailgating parties, complete with tropical decorations, margaritas, and cheeseburgers, at Buffett's live shows.

Writing
--------

Jimmy Buffett is also a prolific author, having written several bestselling novels and memoirs. His first book, "The Jolly Mon," was published in 1988, followed by "Tales from Margaritaville" in 1989. His 2004 memoir, "A Salty Piece of Land," became a New York Times bestseller. Buffett's writing often explores themes of love, adventure, and self-discovery, set against the backdrop of the Gulf Coast and the Caribbean.

Film and Television
-------------------

Jimmy Buffett has made numerous appearances in film and television, often playing himself or making cameo appearances.

### Soundtracks

Buffett has contributed to several film soundtracks, including "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" (1982), "Cocktail" (1988), and "Fool's Gold" (2008).

### Cameo Appearances

Buffett has made cameo appearances in several films and television shows, including "The Simpsons," "Hawaii Five-0," and "Jurassic World."

Theatre
-------

Jimmy Buffett's music has been featured in several stage productions, including the musical "Escape to Margaritaville," which premiered on Broadway in 2018.

Business Ventures
-----------------

Jimmy Buffett has built a business empire that includes restaurants, resorts, and other ventures.

### Restaurants

Buffett has opened several restaurants, including Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville, a chain of tropical-themed restaurants and bars that serve margaritas and cheeseburgers.

### Record Labels

Buffett has founded several record labels, including Mailboat Records and Margaritaville Records, which have released music by Buffett and other artists.

### Beer

Buffett has launched several beer brands, including LandShark Lager and Margaritaville Brewing Company.

### Casinos

Buffett has partnered with several casinos, including the Margaritaville Resort Casino in Bossier City, Louisiana.

### Sports

Buffett has invested in several sports teams, including the New Orleans Saints and the Miami Dolphins.

### Video Games

Buffett has appeared in several video games, including "Margaritaville Online" and "Jimmy Buffett: Margaritaville."

### Retirement Communities

Buffett has partnered with several retirement communities, including Latitude Margaritaville, a chain of tropical-themed retirement communities.

### Cannabis

### Berkshire Hathaway

Charity Work
------------

Jimmy Buffett is a dedicated philanthropist, supporting several charitable causes.

### Environmental Conservation

Buffett has supported several environmental conservation efforts, including the Save the Manatee Club and the Surfrider Foundation.

### Charity Performances

Buffett has performed at numerous charity events, including benefits for Hurricane Katrina relief and the American Red Cross.

### Disaster Relief

Buffett has supported disaster relief efforts, including the 2010 Haiti earthquake and Hurricane Irma.

Personal Life
-------------

Jimmy Buffett has been married twice, first to Margie Washichek from 1969 to 1972, and then to Jane Slagsvol in 1977. He has three children, Savannah, Sarah, and Cameron.

### Illness and Death

Buffett has been open about his struggles with health issues, including a 2011 bout with bronchitis and a 2016 fall that required surgery. He has also been a vocal advocate for cancer research, having lost his mother to the disease in 1991.

Jimmy Buffett has received numerous awards and honors for his contributions to music, philanthropy, and business.

article:
Open-source video game
=====================

Open-source video games are video games that are released under an open-source license, allowing users to view, modify, and distribute the game's source code. This approach to game development has gained popularity over the years, with many notable examples of open-source games being released. In this article, we will explore the definition and differentiation of open-source video games, their background, history, and notable trends and developments.

# Definition and differentiation

Open-source video games are typically defined as games that are released under an open-source license, such as the GNU General Public License (GPL) or the MIT License. This means that the game's source code is freely available for anyone to view, modify, and distribute. In contrast, proprietary games are released under a closed-source license, where the source code is not publicly available.

Open-source games can be differentiated from other types of games in several ways. Firstly, open-source games are often developed by communities of volunteers, rather than by commercial game development companies. Secondly, open-source games are typically released free of charge, whereas proprietary games are often sold for profit. Finally, open-source games often have a more flexible and adaptable development process, as the source code can be modified and distributed by anyone.

# Background

The concept of open-source software has been around since the 1980s, when Richard Stallman founded the Free Software Foundation (FSF) and developed the GNU General Public License (GPL). However, it wasn't until the 1990s that open-source software began to gain mainstream popularity, with the release of the Linux operating system and other notable open-source projects.

The video game industry has traditionally been dominated by proprietary games, with companies like Electronic Arts (EA) and Activision Blizzard releasing games under closed-source licenses. However, in recent years, there has been a growing trend towards open-source game development, with many notable examples of open-source games being released.

# History

## Beginnings and early games

One of the earliest examples of an open-source video game is the game "Doom", which was released in 1993 by id Software. Although Doom was not initially released under an open-source license, the game's source code was later released under the GNU General Public License (GPL) in 1997.

Another early example of an open-source game is the game "Quake", which was released by id Software in 1996. Quake's source code was also released under the GPL, allowing users to modify and distribute the game.

## 3D games and source releases

In the late 1990s and early 2000s, there was a growing trend towards the release of 3D games under open-source licenses. One notable example is the game "Quake III Arena", which was released by id Software in 1999. Quake III Arena's source code was released under the GPL in 2005, allowing users to modify and distribute the game.

Another notable example is the game "Return to Castle Wolfenstein", which was released by id Software in 2001. Return to Castle Wolfenstein's source code was released under the GPL in 2002, allowing users to modify and distribute the game.

## Rise in popularity and diversity

In the mid-2000s, there was a significant increase in the popularity of open-source games, with many new projects being released. One notable example is the game "World of Goo", which was released by 2D Boy in 2008. World of Goo's source code was released under the GPL, allowing users to modify and distribute the game.

Another notable example is the game "Minecraft", which was released by Mojang in 2011. Minecraft's source code was not initially released under an open-source license, but the game's creator, Markus Persson, later released the game's source code under the GPL.

## Greater organization

In recent years, there has been a growing trend towards greater organization and coordination in the open-source game development community. One notable example is the Open Source Game Development and Distribution (OSGDD) project, which was founded in 2013. OSGDD is a non-profit organization that aims to promote and support open-source game development and distribution.

Another notable example is the Open Source Game Engine (OSGE) project, which was founded in 2015. OSGE is a community-driven project that aims to create a free and open-source game engine that can be used for a wide range of games.

## Hubs and development teams

There are also several notable hubs and development teams that are involved in open-source game development. One notable example is the Open Source Game Development (OSGD) community, which is a community-driven project that aims to promote and support open-source game development.

Another notable example is the FOSS Game Dev community, which is a community-driven project that aims to promote and support free and open-source game development.

# See also

* Open-source video game development
* Open-source game engines
* FOSS game dev
* OSGD

# References

* None

# External links

* Open Source Game Development and Distribution (OSGDD)
* Open Source Game Engine (OSGE)
* Open Source Game Development (OSGD) community
* FOSS Game Dev community

#Early life

His parents, both music enthusiasts, introduced him to various genres, including electronic, rock, and hip-hop. Tsumyoki's interest in music production began when he was a teenager, and he started experimenting with music software and equipment.

Growing up in Tokyo, Tsumyoki was surrounded by the city's vibrant music culture, which had a significant impact on his musical style. He was particularly drawn to the city's underground electronic music scene, where he discovered the sounds of Goa trance and psytrance. During this period, he gained a small following online, particularly on social media and music streaming platforms.

In 2019, Tsumyoki released his debut EP, "Kaleidoscope," which marked the beginning of his journey as a professional music producer. The EP received positive feedback from fans and critics, who praised his unique blend of electronic and psychedelic sounds.

##2019–present: Rise to success

In 2019, Tsumyoki's career gained momentum with the release of his single "Sakura." The song, which combined elements of Goa trance and trap music, became a viral hit online and helped establish Tsumyoki as a rising star in the electronic music scene.

Over the next few years, Tsumyoki released a string of successful singles and EPs, including "Neo Tokyo" and "Rising Sun." These releases solidified his position as a leading figure in the Goa trap movement and earned him recognition from fans and critics around the world.

In 2020, Tsumyoki released his debut album, "Goa Trap Culture," which debuted at number one on the Japanese electronic music charts. The album received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Tsumyoki's innovative production style and genre-bending sound.

It is characterized by its blend of Goa trance and trap music, often featuring complex rhythms and psychedelic soundscapes. Tsumyoki is widely regarded as one of the leading figures in the Goa trap movement, and his music has helped to popularize the genre around the world.

Tsumyoki's unique blend of Goa trance and trap music is inspired by his cultural heritage and his love of electronic music. He often incorporates traditional Japanese instruments and melodies into his music, which adds a distinctive flavor to his sound.

2023–24 Figure Skating Season

The 2023–24 figure skating season began on July 1, 2023, and will end on June 30, 2024. During this period, elite figure skaters will compete on the international stage in various events, including the ISU Grand Prix series, the ISU Junior Grand Prix series, the ISU World Championships, and other competitions.

# Season Notes

## Age Eligibility

To be eligible to compete in the 2023–24 season, skaters must have reached the minimum age requirement as of July 1, 2023. The minimum age requirements for the 2023–24 season are as follows:

* Men's singles and women's singles: 13 years old
* Pairs: 13 years old (ladies), 14 years old (men)
* Ice dance: 13 years old (ladies), 14 years old (men)

# Changes

## Partnership Changes

Several pairs and ice dance teams have made changes to their partnerships for the 2023–24 season. Some of the notable changes include:

* Ashley Cain-Gribble and Timothy LeDuc (USA) announced their split and will be skating with new partners.
* Vanessa James and Eric Radford (CAN) announced their split and will be skating with new partners.
* Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA) announced that they will be taking a break from competition and will not be competing together in the 2023–24 season.

## Retirements

Several notable figure skaters have announced their retirement from competitive skating in the 2023–24 season. Some of the notable retirees include:

* Nathan Chen (USA) announced his retirement from competitive skating after the 2022-23 season.
* Evgenia Medvedeva (RUS) announced her retirement from competitive skating after the 2022-23 season.
* Meagan Duhamel and Eric Radford (CAN) announced their retirement from competitive skating after the 2022-23 season.

## Coaching Changes

* Yuna Kim (KOR) announced that she will be working with a new coaching team for the 2023–24 season.

## Nationality Changes

Several skaters have made changes to their nationality for the 2023–24 season. Some of the notable changes include:

* Ilia Malinin (RUS) announced that he will be competing for the United States in the 2023–24 season.
* Sofia Samodurova (RUS) announced that she will be competing for Israel in the 2023–24 season.
* Alexandra Boikova (RUS) announced that she will be competing for Georgia in the 2023–24 season.

# International Competitions

## Cancelled

The 2023 European Figure Skating Championships were cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

article:
Tropical Storm Alex (2022)

Tropical Storm Alex was a tropical cyclone that formed in the Atlantic Ocean in June 2022. The storm developed from a tropical wave that emerged from the coast of West Africa and moved westward across the Atlantic, eventually strengthening into a tropical storm. Alex brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several countries in the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

# Meteorological history

Tropical Storm Alex formed from a tropical wave that emerged from the coast of West Africa on May 31, 2022. The wave moved westward across the Atlantic, gradually developing a closed circulation and convection. On June 2, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) began monitoring the system as a potential tropical cyclone. Over the next few days, the system continued to organize, and on June 5, the NHC upgraded it to a tropical depression.

The depression strengthened into a tropical storm on June 6, and the NHC assigned it the name Alex. At the time, Alex was located about 1,000 miles (1,609 km) east of the Lesser Antilles, moving west-northwestward at 20 mph (32 km/h). The storm continued to strengthen, and on June 7, Alex reached its peak intensity as a tropical storm, with maximum sustained winds of 70 mph (113 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 984 mbar (29.06 inHg).

After reaching its peak, Alex began to weaken due to increasing wind shear and dry air. On June 9, the storm made landfall in Cuba, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds to the island. Alex then emerged into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, where it continued to weaken. On June 10, the storm made landfall in Florida, bringing tropical storm-force winds and heavy rainfall to the state.

# Preparations and impact

## Cuba

In preparation for the storm, the Cuban government issued a tropical storm warning for the entire island. Residents were advised to stay indoors and avoid traveling, especially in areas prone to flooding. The government also set up shelters and evacuation centers in anticipation of the storm's arrival.

Alex made landfall in Cuba on June 9, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds to the island. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 100,000 households left without electricity. The Cuban government reported that the storm caused significant damage to homes, buildings, and infrastructure, especially in the provinces of Pinar del Río and Artemisa.

## Florida

In preparation for the storm, the state of Florida issued a tropical storm warning for several counties, including Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach. Residents were advised to stay indoors and avoid traveling, especially in areas prone to flooding. The state also set up shelters and evacuation centers in anticipation of the storm's arrival.

Alex made landfall in Florida on June 10, bringing tropical storm-force winds and heavy rainfall to the state. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 200,000 households left without electricity. The Florida Department of Transportation reported that the storm caused significant damage to roads and highways, especially in the Miami-Dade and Broward counties.

## The Bahamas

In preparation for the storm, the Bahamian government issued a tropical storm warning for the entire archipelago. Residents were advised to stay indoors and avoid traveling, especially in areas prone to flooding. The government also set up shelters and evacuation centers in anticipation of the storm's arrival.

Alex passed close to the Bahamas on June 9, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds to the islands. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 10,000 households left without electricity. The Bahamian government reported that the storm caused significant damage to homes, buildings, and infrastructure, especially in the islands of Grand Bahama and Abaco.

2022 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup

The 2022 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup was the seventh edition of the FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup, the international basketball tournament for youth men's national teams. The tournament was held in Spain from July 2 to July 10, 2022.

# Qualified teams

A total of 16 teams qualified for the tournament from the FIBA Under-16 regional championships. The teams were:

*  Africa: Egypt, Mali
*  Americas: Argentina, Canada, Dominican Republic, United States
*  Asia: Australia, China, Japan
*  Europe: France, Lithuania, Poland, Spain
*  Oceania: New Zealand

# Venue

The tournament was held in the city of Málaga, Spain, at the Polideportivo Municipal de Carranque.

# Draw

The draw for the tournament was held on May 31, 2022, in Málaga, Spain.

## Seeding

The teams were seeded based on their performance at the 2020 FIBA Under-16 regional championships.

*  Pot 1: United States, Spain, France, Australia
*  Pot 2: Argentina, Canada, Lithuania, Poland
*  Pot 3: China, Dominican Republic, Egypt, Japan
*  Pot 4: Mali, New Zealand, China

# Preliminary round

The preliminary round was played in a round-robin format, with the top three teams from each group advancing to the final round.

The Menu (2022 film)

The Menu is a 2022 American black comedy horror film directed by Mark Mylod and written by Seth Reiss and Will Tracy. The film stars Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, Nicholas Hoult, and Hong Chau. It follows a young couple who travel to a remote island to eat at an exclusive restaurant, only to find themselves embroiled in a sinister plot.

# Plot

The film begins with Tyler (Nicholas Hoult) and Margot (Anya Taylor-Joy), a young couple who are excited to dine at Hawthorne, an exclusive restaurant located on a remote island. The restaurant is run by the charismatic and renowned chef, Julian Slowik (Ralph Fiennes). The couple arrives on the island with a group of wealthy and pretentious diners, including a food critic, a wealthy couple, and a businessman.

As the evening progresses, the guests are treated to an exquisite meal, but things take a dark turn when Chef Slowik reveals that the menu has been designed to cater to their deepest fears and insecurities. The guests soon realize that they are trapped on the island and that the chef has a sinister plan in store for them.

As the night wears on, the guests are subjected to a series of twisted and gruesome challenges, all designed to expose their true nature. Margot, who is initially hesitant to participate, soon finds herself drawn into the game, while Tyler becomes increasingly unhinged.

As the guests are slowly picked off one by one, Margot begins to suspect that there is more to Chef Slowik's plan than meets the eye. She discovers that the chef has a personal vendetta against the wealthy elite and that the menu is designed to punish them for their sins.

In the end, Margot is the only one who survives the night, but not without scars. She escapes the island, but not before Chef Slowik reveals his true intentions and the true horror of the menu.

# Cast

The film was produced by Adam McKay and Betsy Koch, who are both known for their work on the film Vice. The film was shot on location in Savannah, Georgia, and the surrounding islands.

## Casting

The cast of The Menu includes a number of well-known actors, including Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, and Nicholas Hoult. The cast was announced in February 2021, and filming began in March 2021.

Ralph Fiennes was the first actor to be cast in the film, and he was drawn to the project because of the complexity of the character of Chef Slowik. Anya Taylor-Joy was cast as Margot, and she was attracted to the project because of the strong female character.

Nicholas Hoult was cast as Tyler, and he was drawn to the project because of the complexity of the character. The rest of the cast, including Hong Chau, Janet McTeer, and Reed Birney, were cast in supporting roles.

## Filming

Filming on The Menu began in March 2021, and it took place on location in Savannah, Georgia, and the surrounding islands. The film was shot on a relatively low budget, and it was filmed using a combination of digital and film cameras.

The film's cinematographer, Pawel Edelman, used a combination of close-ups and wide shots to capture the tension and unease of the characters. The film's production designer, Ethan Tobman, created a realistic and immersive set that added to the tension and unease of the characters.

## Music

The music for The Menu was composed by Colin Stetson, who is known for his work on the film Hereditary. The score is a combination of orchestral and electronic elements, and it adds to the tension and unease of the characters.

The score features a number of unsettling and unnerving themes, including a haunting melody that plays during the opening credits. The music is used sparingly throughout the film, but it adds to the overall sense of unease and tension.

# Release

The Menu was released in theaters on November 18, 2022. The film was released by Searchlight Pictures, and it was distributed by 20th Century Studios.

The film received a wide release, and it was shown in over 3,000 theaters across the United States. The film was also released internationally, and it was shown in a number of countries around the world.

# Reception

The Menu was a commercial success, and it grossed over $70 million at the box office. The film opened at number two at the box office, and it stayed in the top 10 for several weeks.

The film's success was due in part to its strong word-of-mouth, and it received a number of positive reviews from critics. The film's success was also due in part to its unique and original premise, and it appealed to a wide range of audiences.

article:
2022 Italian General Election

The 2022 Italian general election was held on 25 September 2022 to elect the members of the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate of the Republic, the two houses of the Italian Parliament. The election was called after the fall of the Draghi government, which had been in power since February 2021. The election saw a significant shift in the Italian political landscape, with the centre-right coalition winning a majority of seats in both houses.

Background

The 2022 Italian general election was the first to be held after the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the country's economy and society. The previous government, led by Mario Draghi, had been formed in February 2021 after the resignation of Giuseppe Conte, and had been supported by a broad coalition of parties, including the Five Star Movement (M5S), the Democratic Party (PD), and the League. However, the government's popularity began to decline in the summer of 2022, and on 21 July, Draghi submitted his resignation to the President of the Republic, Sergio Mattarella.

Electoral campaign

The electoral campaign lasted for approximately two months, during which the main parties and coalitions presented their programmes and candidates to the electorate.

Main parties' slogans

* Brothers of Italy (FdI): "Italy deserves respect"
* Democratic Party (PD): "The future is in common"
* Five Star Movement (M5S): "We are the ones we've been waiting for"
* League (Lega): "The right idea for Italy"
* Forza Italia (FI): "The centre-right for Italy"

Electoral debates

Several electoral debates were held during the campaign, involving the leaders of the main parties and coalitions. The most notable debate was the one held on 16 September, which saw the participation of Giorgia Meloni (FdI), Enrico Letta (PD), Giuseppe Conte (M5S), Matteo Salvini (Lega), and Silvio Berlusconi (FI).

Electoral system

Italy uses a mixed electoral system, which combines proportional representation and first-past-the-post (FPTP) systems. The Chamber of Deputies is elected using a proportional system, while the Senate of the Republic is elected using a mixed system, with 74% of seats allocated using FPTP and 26% using proportional representation.

Electoral lists

 Lists with parliamentary representation

* Brothers of Italy (FdI)
* Democratic Party (PD)
* Five Star Movement (M5S)
* League (Lega)
* Forza Italia (FI)
* Action - Italia Viva (A-IV)
* More Europe (+Eu)
* Green and Left Alliance (AVS)

Lists without parliamentary representation

* Italexit (IE)
* Italian Left (LS)
* Communist Party (PC)
* New Force (FN)
* 3V Movement (M3V)

Lists running only in overseas constituencies

* Associative Movement of Italians Abroad (MAIE)
* South American Union of Italian Emigrants (USEI)

Opinion polls

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign, and showed a consistent lead for the centre-right coalition, led by Giorgia Meloni. The final polls, published on 23 September, showed the following results:

* Centre-right coalition: 43-46%
* Centre-left coalition: 25-28%
* Five Star Movement (M5S): 13-15%
* Action - Italia Viva (A-IV): 7-9%
* More Europe (+Eu): 2-4%

Voter turnout

The voter turnout was 63.8%, down from 72.9% in the 2018 general election.

Results

Chamber of Deputies

Overall results

The centre-right coalition, led by Giorgia Meloni, won 237 seats, while the centre-left coalition, led by Enrico Letta, won 142 seats. The Five Star Movement (M5S) won 52 seats, and Action - Italia Viva (A-IV) won 21 seats.

The killing of Jordan Neely was a widely reported incident that occurred on May 1, 2023, in New York City's subway system. The case drew widespread media attention and sparked protests and debates about police brutality, racism, and the treatment of homeless individuals.

# Incident

On May 1, 2023, Jordan Neely was riding a subway train in Manhattan when he allegedly became aggressive and disorderly, prompting other passengers to call for assistance. Daniel Penny, who was also on the train, intervened and attempted to restrain Neely. A struggle ensued, and Penny ultimately used a chokehold to subdue Neely. Neely lost consciousness and was pronounced dead at the scene.

Jordan Neely was a 30-year-old homeless man who struggled with mental health issues and substance abuse. article:
Minions: The Rise of Gru

Minions: The Rise of Gru is a 2022 American computer-animated comedy film produced by Illumination and Universal Pictures. The film is a sequel to the 2015 film Minions and the fifth installment in the Despicable Me franchise. It follows the story of a 12-year-old Gru, who dreams of becoming a supervillain and joining a group of villains known as the Vicious 6.

#Plot

The film takes place in the 1970s and follows the story of a 12-year-old Gru (voiced by Steve Carell), who is a young boy with a dream of becoming a supervillain. Gru lives with his mother, Marlena (voiced by Julie Andrews), who is supportive of his dreams but also wants him to focus on his studies. Gru is obsessed with a group of villains known as the Vicious 6, who are known for their evil deeds and high-tech gadgets. The Vicious 6 is led by Wild Knuckles (voiced by Alan Arkin), a villain who has stolen the legendary Zodiac Stone, a powerful artifact that grants immense power to its owner.

Gru decides to apply for a job with the Vicious 6, but his application is rejected. However, he soon finds himself face-to-face with the Vicious 6, who are impressed by his skills and decide to give him a chance. Gru becomes the youngest member of the Vicious 6 and quickly becomes obsessed with the Zodiac Stone. However, things take a turn when Gru steals the stone and becomes the target of the Vicious 6, who will stop at nothing to get it back.

Meanwhile, Gru's loyal Minion friends, Kevin, Stuart, and Bob (voiced by Pierre Coffin), set out on a journey to find Gru and help him in his mission to become a supervillain. Along the way, they encounter a group of villains who are also after the Zodiac Stone, leading to a series of hilarious and action-packed battles.

#Voice cast

The film features an all-star voice cast, including Steve Carell as the voice of Gru, Pierre Coffin as the voice of the Minions, and Alan Arkin as the voice of Wild Knuckles. The film also features the voice talents of Taraji P. Henson, Michelle Yeoh, Julie Andrews, and Danny Trejo, among others.

#Production

Minions: The Rise of Gru was produced by Illumination and Universal Pictures, with Chris Renaud and Patrick Delage serving as producers. The film was directed by Kyle Balda, who also directed the 2015 film Minions. The screenplay was written by Matthew Fogel, who also wrote the screenplay for the 2017 film Despicable Me 3.

The film was produced on a budget of $80 million and took over four years to complete. The animation was produced by Illumination's animation studio in Paris, France, with a team of over 500 animators and technicians working on the film.

#Music

The film's score was composed by Heitor Pereira, who also composed the score for the 2015 film Minions. The soundtrack features a mix of classic 1970s songs and original compositions, including the hit single "Turn Up the Sunshine" by Diana Ross and Tame Impala.

#Marketing and release

Minions: The Rise of Gru was released on July 1, 2022, in the United States and on July 15, 2022, in the United Kingdom. The film was released in over 4,500 theaters in the United States and was projected to gross over $100 million in its opening weekend.

The film's marketing campaign was launched in February 2022, with the release of the film's first trailer. The trailer featured a mix of action-packed sequences and hilarious moments, showcasing the film's humor and style.

##Box office

Minions: The Rise of Gru grossed over $939 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2022. The film grossed over $369 million in the United States and over $570 million internationally.

##Critical response

Minions: The Rise of Gru received generally positive reviews from critics, with an approval rating of 70% on Rotten Tomatoes. The film was praised for its humor, action sequences, and voice cast, with many critics praising Steve Carell's performance as Gru.

###Gentleminions TikTok trend

The film's release coincided with a popular TikTok trend known as "Gentleminions," in which fans of the film would dress up in suits and attend screenings of the film. The trend became a viral sensation, with many fans sharing photos and videos of themselves dressed up as "Gentleminions" on social media.

##Accolades

Minions: The Rise of Gru received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Animated Feature at the 2022 Annie Awards. The film also received several nominations at the 2022 Kids' Choice Awards, including Favorite Animated Movie and Favorite Voice Actor for Steve Carell.

#Sequel

A sequel to Minions: The Rise of Gru is currently in development, with Illumination and Universal Pictures set to produce the film. The film is expected to be released in 2024, with Chris Renaud and Patrick Delage set to produce.

article:
Neoplatonism

Neoplatonism is a philosophical and spiritual movement that emerged in the 3rd century AD, rooted in the ideas of the ancient Greek philosopher Plato. It is characterized by a complex and multifaceted system of thought that combines elements of mysticism, metaphysics, and ethics. Neoplatonism had a profound impact on Western philosophy, influencing various intellectual traditions, including Christianity, Islam, and Judaism.

#Origins of the term

The term "Neoplatonism" was coined in the 19th century to distinguish the philosophical ideas of the ancient Greeks from those of the modern era. The prefix "Neo-" means "new," indicating a revival or reinterpretation of Platonic thought. However, the term "Neoplatonism" is somewhat misleading, as it implies a direct and unbroken continuity between the philosophy of Plato and the ideas of the Neoplatonists. In reality, Neoplatonism represents a distinct and innovative development of Platonic thought, influenced by various intellectual and cultural currents of the Hellenistic and Roman periods.

#Origins and history of classical Neoplatonism

##Hellenism

Neoplatonism emerged in the context of Hellenism, a cultural and intellectual movement that spread throughout the Mediterranean world in the centuries following the conquests of Alexander the Great. Hellenism was characterized by a blending of Greek and non-Greek cultures, as well as a renewed interest in classical Greek philosophy and literature. Neoplatonism was one of several philosophical schools that flourished during this period, including Stoicism, Epicureanism, and Skepticism.

##Ammonius Saccas

The founder of Neoplatonism is often identified as Ammonius Saccas, a Egyptian philosopher who taught in Alexandria during the 3rd century AD. Little is known about Ammonius' life and teachings, but his influence on subsequent Neoplatonists is undeniable. According to tradition, Ammonius was a Christian who became disillusioned with the dogmatic and sectarian tendencies of early Christianity, leading him to seek a more profound and universal understanding of reality through the study of Plato and other philosophers.

##Plotinus

The most famous and influential Neoplatonist was Plotinus, a student of Ammonius who taught in Rome during the 3rd century AD. Plotinus' teachings were compiled by his student Porphyry into a collection of writings known as the Enneads, which remain the central texts of Neoplatonism to this day. Plotinus' philosophy is characterized by a complex and nuanced understanding of the nature of reality, the human soul, and the ultimate goal of human existence.

##Porphyry

Porphyry was a student of Plotinus who played a crucial role in the development and dissemination of Neoplatonism. In addition to compiling the Enneads, Porphyry wrote several influential works on philosophy, including the Isagoge, a manual on logic and metaphysics that became a standard textbook in the ancient world.

##Iamblichus

Iamblichus was a Neoplatonist who taught in Syria during the 4th century AD. He is known for his emphasis on the importance of ritual and spiritual practices, such as theurgy, in the attainment of spiritual enlightenment. Iamblichus' teachings had a profound impact on the development of Western esotericism, influencing various spiritual traditions, including Hermeticism and Gnosticism.

##Academies

Neoplatonism was often taught in academic settings, such as the Academy of Athens, which was founded by Plato in the 4th century BC. The Academy continued to flourish throughout the Hellenistic and Roman periods, becoming a center of Neoplatonic learning and scholarship.

##Hypatia

Hypatia was a Neoplatonist and mathematician who taught in Alexandria during the 4th century AD. She was known for her beauty, intelligence, and eloquence, and was revered by her students and contemporaries. Hypatia's teachings emphasized the importance of reason, wisdom, and spiritual growth.

##Proclus

Proclus was a Neoplatonist who taught in Athens during the 5th century AD. He is known for his comprehensive and systematic understanding of Neoplatonic philosophy, which he presented in a series of works, including the Platonic Theology and the Elements of Theology.

#Ideas

Neoplatonism is characterized by a complex and multifaceted system of thought that combines elements of metaphysics, epistemology, and ethics.

##The One

At the heart of Neoplatonism is the concept of the One, a unified and ultimate reality that underlies all existence. The One is considered to be the source of all being, the ultimate principle of unity and coherence.

##Emanations

The One is seen as the source of a series of emanations, or radiations, that give rise to the various levels of reality, including the material world. These emanations are seen as a series of gradations, each of which represents a decreasing level of unity and coherence.

###Demiurge or nous

The first emanation is the Demiurge, or Nous, which is seen as the divine intelligence that governs the universe. The Demiurge is considered to be the source of all order and coherence in the universe.

###World-soul

The second emanation is the World-Soul, which is seen as the source of all life and animation in the universe.

###Phenomenal world

The third emanation is the phenomenal world, which is seen as the realm of sensory experience and material existence.

##Celestial hierarchy

Neoplatonism posits a celestial hierarchy, a series of levels of reality that reflect the emanations of the One. This hierarchy includes the angels, demons, and other spiritual beings that inhabit the various levels of reality.

##Evil

Neoplatonism has a complex and nuanced understanding of evil, which is seen as a privation or lack of being, rather than a positive reality. Evil is considered to be a result of the emanations, rather than a direct creation of the One.

##Return to the One

The ultimate goal of human existence is seen as a return to the One, a reunification with the ultimate reality that underlies all existence. This return is achieved through the practice of spiritual disciplines, such as contemplation and theurgy.

#Influence

Neoplatonism had a profound impact on Western philosophy, influencing various intellectual traditions, including Christianity, Islam, and Judaism.

##Early Christianity

Neoplatonism had a significant influence on early Christianity, particularly in the development of Christian theology and mysticism.

###Augustine

Augustine, one of the most influential Christian theologians, was heavily influenced by Neoplatonism. His teachings on the nature of God, the human soul, and the ultimate goal of human existence reflect a strong Neoplatonic influence.

###Origen and Pseudo-Dionysius

Origen and Pseudo-Dionysius, two influential Christian theologians, were also influenced by Neoplatonism. Their teachings on the nature of God, the universe, and the human soul reflect a strong Neoplatonic influence.

###Gnosticism

Neoplatonism also influenced Gnosticism, a spiritual movement that emerged in the 1st century AD. Gnosticism emphasized the importance of spiritual knowledge and the attainment of gnosis, or spiritual enlightenment.

##Byzantine education

Neoplatonism played a significant role in Byzantine education, particularly in the development of philosophy and theology.

##Islamic neoplatonism

Neoplatonism also influenced Islamic philosophy, particularly in the development of Sufism, a mystical tradition that emphasizes the importance of spiritual growth and self-realization.

##Jewish thought

Neoplatonism influenced Jewish thought, particularly in the development of Kabbalah, a mystical tradition that emphasizes the importance of spiritual growth and self-realization.

##Medieval Christian Thought

Neoplatonism continued to influence medieval Christian thought, particularly in the development of scholasticism, a philosophical movement that emphasized the importance of reason and intellectual inquiry.

##Western Renaissance

Neoplatonism played a significant role in the Western Renaissance, particularly in the development of humanism and the revival of classical learning.

##Cambridge Platonists (17th century)

The Cambridge Platonists, a group of English philosophers, were influenced by Neoplatonism. Their teachings emphasized the importance of reason, spirituality, and the attainment of gnosis.

##Modern neoplatonism

Neoplatonism continues to influence modern thought, particularly in the development of various spiritual and philosophical traditions, including New Age thought and contemporary spirituality.

#See also

* Platonic Academy
* Neopythagoreanism
* Gnosticism

article:
2022 ATP Tour

The 2022 ATP Tour was the global elite men's professional tennis circuit organized by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) for the 2022 tennis season. The ATP Tour calendar comprised the Grand Slam tournaments, the ATP Finals, the ATP Masters 1000, the ATP 500 series, the ATP 250 series, and the Davis Cup.

#Schedule

##January
The first month of the season saw the inaugural edition of the ATP Cup, a team-based tournament featuring 16 countries, take place in Australia. The singles tournaments in Melbourne, Adelaide, and Sydney also kicked off the season. Novak Djokovic's visa issues dominated the headlines, leading to his eventual deportation from Australia.

##February
The month began with the Australian Open, the first Grand Slam of the season. Rafael Nadal won a record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title, defeating Daniil Medvedev in a thrilling five-set final. The following weeks saw the ATP 250 series events in Córdoba, Montpellier, and Dallas.

##March
The first ATP Masters 1000 event of the season took place in Indian Wells, where Taylor Fritz won his maiden Masters title. The Miami Open followed, with Carlos Alcaraz claiming his first Masters title. The month concluded with the ATP 500 series event in Dubai.

##April
The clay-court season began with the ATP 500 series event in Barcelona, won by Carlos Alcaraz. The Monte-Carlo Masters saw Stefanos Tsitsipas defend his title. The month concluded with the ATP 250 series events in Belgrade and Munich.

##May
The ATP Masters 1000 events in Madrid and Rome took place, with Alexander Zverev and Novak Djokovic winning respectively. The month concluded with the ATP 250 series events in Lyon and Geneva.

##June
The French Open, the second Grand Slam of the season, took place, with Rafael Nadal claiming a record-extending 14th title. The ATP 500 series event in Halle saw Hubert Hurkacz win his first grass-court title. The month concluded with the ATP 250 series events in London and Mallorca.

##July
The Wimbledon Championships, the third Grand Slam of the season, took place, with Novak Djokovic winning a seventh title. The ATP 250 series events in Newport, Bastad, and Umag followed.

##August
The ATP Masters 1000 events in Montreal and Cincinnati took place, with Pablo Carreño Busta and Borna Ćorić winning respectively. The month concluded with the ATP 250 series events in Winston-Salem and Los Cabos.

##September
The US Open, the fourth and final Grand Slam of the season, took place, with Carlos Alcaraz claiming his maiden Grand Slam title. The ATP 250 series events in Metz, San Diego, and Sofia followed.

##October
The ATP 500 series events in Tokyo and Nur-Sultan took place, with Frances Tiafoe and Novak Djokovic winning respectively. The ATP Masters 1000 event in Shanghai was cancelled due to COVID-19 restrictions. The month concluded with the ATP 250 series events in Antwerp and Stockholm.

##November
The ATP Finals, the season-ending championships, took place in Turin, with Novak Djokovic winning a record-extending sixth title. The month concluded with the Davis Cup Finals.

##Affected tournaments
Several tournaments were affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, with some being cancelled or postponed. The ATP Masters 1000 event in Shanghai was cancelled, while the ATP 500 series event in Beijing was postponed.

#Statistical information

The following players won titles during the 2022 ATP Tour season:

article:
The Bad Guys (film)
=====================

The Bad Guys is a 2022 American computer-animated heist comedy film produced by DreamWorks Animation and distributed by Universal Pictures. The film is based on the children's book series of the same name by Aaron Blabey and marks the directorial debut of Pierre Perifel.

Plot
-----

The film follows the story of a group of animal outcasts known as "The Bad Guys," consisting of Mr. Wolf, a charismatic and cunning wolf; Mr. Snake, a sly and agile snake; Mr. Shark, a great white shark with a talent for disguise; Mr. Piranha, a sharp-toothed piranha with a penchant for violence; and Ms. Tarantula, a tech-savvy tarantula. The group is known for their daring heists, but after being caught by the authorities, they are sentenced to community service.

During their community service, the group meets Professor Marmalade, a guinea pig who is a renowned expert on good behavior. Marmalade takes the group under his wing and teaches them the ways of being good, but Mr. Wolf is skeptical of the professor's intentions. As the group begins to change their ways, they are approached by a new villain, Governor Diane Foxington, who seeks to take advantage of their newfound goodness for her own gain.

Voice cast
------------

* Sam Rockwell as Mr. Wolf
* Marc Maron as Mr. Snake
* Craig Robinson as Mr. Shark
* Anthony Ramos as Mr. Piranha
* Awkwafina as Ms. Tarantula
* Richard Ayoade as Professor Marmalade
* Zazie Beetz as Diane Foxington
* Alex Borstein as Police Chief Misty Luggins

Production
------------

### Development

In 2018, it was announced that DreamWorks Animation had acquired the rights to adapt Aaron Blabey's children's book series "The Bad Guys" into an animated film. Pierre Perifel, a veteran animator and storyboard artist, was hired to make his directorial debut on the project.

### Animation, design, and influences

The film's animation style was inspired by the works of classic animators such as Chuck Jones and Bob Clampett. The character designs were also influenced by the works of illustrators such as Quentin Blake and Jean Giraud. The film's color palette was designed to be vibrant and stylized, with a focus on bold shapes and textures.

The animation process was handled by DreamWorks Animation's studios in Glendale, California, and Bangalore, India. The film's animation team consisted of over 400 artists, animators, and technicians.

Music
------

The film's original score was composed by Daniel Pemberton, who is known for his work on films such as "Ocean's 8" and "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse." The score was performed by a 70-piece orchestra and features a mix of jazz, rock, and electronic elements.

Marketing
---------

The film's marketing campaign was launched in 2021, with the release of a teaser trailer that showcased the film's animation style and humor. The trailer was well-received by fans and critics, and helped to generate buzz for the film.

Release
---------

### Theatrical

The film was released in theaters on April 22, 2022, in the United States and Canada. It was released in IMAX and Dolby Cinema formats, as well as in standard 2D and 3D.

### Home media and streaming

The film was released on digital platforms such as iTunes and Amazon Prime Video on June 21, 2022. It was also released on DVD and Blu-ray on July 12, 2022.

Reception
----------

### Box office

The film was a commercial success, grossing over $250 million worldwide. It opened at number one at the box office in the United States and Canada, and remained in the top five for three weeks.

### Critical response

The film received positive reviews from critics, with an approval rating of 82% on Rotten Tomatoes. The film's animation, humor, and voice cast were praised by critics, with many noting that the film was a fun and entertaining ride.

### Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including the Annie Award for Best Animated Feature and the Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Animated Feature.

Future
--------

### Sequel

In 2022, it was announced that a sequel to the film was in development, with Pierre Perifel set to return as director. The sequel is expected to be released in 2024.

### Television specials

#### Holiday special

A holiday special based on the film is set to be released in 2023. The special will feature the voice cast from the film and will be a fun and festive addition to the franchise.

#### Halloween special

A Halloween special based on the film is also in development, with a release date set for 2023. The special will feature the voice cast from the film and will be a spooky and fun addition to the franchise.

References
----------
